text: Oracle against Tyre
The oracle of Tyre:
Wail, ships of Tarshish, for ⸤the house is destroyed so that no one can enter⸥;\f + \fr 23:1 \ft Literally “it is destroyed from a house from entering” \f*
it is announced to them from the land of Cyprus.
Be still, inhabitants of \add the\add* coast,
merchant of Sidon, who travels over \add the\add* sea, they filled you.
And on \add the\add* great waters \add is\add* the seed of Shihor,
the harvest of the Nile \add is\add* its produce,
and she was \add the\add* merchandise of \add the\add* nations.
Be ashamed, Sidon, for \add the\add* sea,
the fortress of the sea said, saying,
“I was not in labor,
and I have not given birth,
and I have not reared young men,
brought\f + \fr 23:4 \ft Or “I have brought” \f* up young women.”
When \add the\add* report \add comes\add* to Egypt,
they will be in anguish at the report ⸤about⸥\f + \fr 23:5 \ft Literally “of” \f* Tyre.
Cross over \add to\add* Tarshish!
Wail, inhabitants of \add the\add* coast!
⸤Is this your exultant one⸥,\f + \fr 23:7 \ft Literally “this to you, exultant” \f* her origin from the days of long ago?
Her feet brought her to dwell afar as an alien.
Who has planned this against Tyre, the bestower of crowns,\f + \fr 23:8 \ft Hebrew “crown” \f*
whose merchants \add were\add* princes,
her traders \add the\add* honored ones of \add the\add* earth?
Yahweh of hosts has planned it:
to defile \add the\add* pride of all glory,
to humble all \add the\add* honored ones of \add the\add* earth.
Cross over your \add own\add* land like the Nile, daughter of Tarshish;
there is no longer a harbor.\f + \fr 23:10 \ft Hebrew “waistband” is emended to “harbor” by transposing two consonants \f*
He has stretched his hand out over the sea;
he has made kingdoms shake.
Yahweh has commanded concerning Canaan
to destroy her fortresses.
And he said,
“You will not ⸤continue⸥\f + \fr 23:12 \ft Literally “do again longer” \f* to exult, crushed one, ⸤virgin⸥\f + \fr 23:12 \ft Literally “virgin of the” \f* daughter of Sidon.
Arise, cross over \add to\add* Cyprus! There will be no rest for you even there.”
Look \add at\add* the land of the Chaldeans!
⸤This people no longer exists.
Assyria destined⸥\f + \fr 23:13 \ft Literally “this people was not Assyria destined,” which could be translated “It was this people! It was not Assyria. They destined” \f* it for wild animals.
They erected its siege towers;
they demolished its citadel fortresses.
It made her like a ruin.
Wail, ships of Tarshish!
For your fortress is destroyed.

And this will happen on that day: And Tyre \add will\add* be forgotten seventy years,\f + \fr 23:15 \ft Hebrew “year” \f* like the days of one king. At \add the\add* end of seventy years,\f + \fr 23:15 \ft Hebrew “year” \f* it will be for Tyre like the song of the prostitute:
“Take a harp,
go around \add the\add* city, forgotten prostitute!
Do \add it\add* well, playing a stringed instrument!
Make numerous songs,\f + \fr 23:16 \ft Hebrew “song” \f* that you may be remembered.”
And this shall happen:
at \add the\add* end of seventy years,\f + \fr 23:17 \ft Hebrew “year” \f* Yahweh will visit Tyre,
and she will return to her harlot’s wages,
and she will commit fornication
with all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.
And this shall happen:
her merchandise and her harlot’s wages \add will be\add* set apart for Yahweh;
it will not be stored up,
and it will not be hoarded,
but her merchandise will be for those who live before the ⸤presence⸥\f + \fr 23:18 \ft Literally “face” \f* of Yahweh,
for eating to satiation and for fine clothing.
